item.title: No-cost System Lockdown, Part 2: Open Source IDS in Use
item.description: Part 1 gave you a rundown of the most popular open source IDS solutions. Now learn how to protect your servers by employing common, practical uses for these solutions.
item.author: white@extrasy.net (Alexander Prohorenko)

item.title: Open Source Intrusion Detection: No-cost System Lockdown
item.description: Have you found commercial intrusion detection systems (IDS) to be overkill or just too expensive? Open source IDS projects offer a use-only-what-you-need alternative—and of course, they're free. Get a rundown of the most popular non-commercial IDS solutions.
item.author: white@extrasy.net (Alexander Prohorenko)

item.title: SOAP's Alive: Try the New Native SOAP Extensions for PHP
item.description: With PHP5, Web services and everybody's favorite open source Web development language are now native pals.
item.author: lmoroney@philotic.com (Laurence Moroney)

item.title: Use SWT Listener Classes Effectively for Responsive Java UIs
item.description: By using the SWT listener classes effectively as this article prescribes, you can win the hearts of your Java application users with highly responsive GUIs.
item.author: dsraghu@hotmail.com (Raghu Donepudi)

item.title: Build an Object-oriented File System in PHP
item.description: Using a simple file storage convention and some PHP code, you can create a hierarchical file system that mimics many object-oriented concepts, facilitates reuse, and simplifies your Web development efforts.
item.author: devx@toykeeper.net (Scott Scriven)

item.title: Validating Email Addresses with Regular Expressions in PHP
item.description: This class uses regular expressions and PHP to validate email addresses for misprints or false entries.
item.author: Cem Aykan aykan@coe.neu.edu

item.title: How to Install and Use Cloudscape
item.description: IBM's open-source embedded database delivers a full relational DBMS with remarkably low administrative overhead. This no-hassle design applies to developing for Cloudscape as well.
item.author: abinstock@pacificdataworks.com (Andrew Binstock)

item.title: WindowBuilder Pro: Advanced Java GUI Creation in Eclipse
item.description: Want to build Java user interfaces without drowning in the minutia of the Java GUI libraries? WindowBuilder Pro may be the tool for you. Learn all about this Eclipse plug-in as Jason Morris puts it to the test.
item.author: counsulting@morristechnicalsolutions.com (Jason Morris)

item.title: Get AMPed over Uniform Server and Build a Data-driven Web Site in Nothing Flat
item.description: Web development gets easier all the time, but Uniform Server, an open source project that packs up the ease and power of the 'AMP' platform, takes simplicity to the edge of embarrassing. Go from zero to Web hero in minutes by using our sample blog project to teach yourself the ease and power of AMP.
item.author: lmoroney@philotic.com (Laurence Moroney)

item.title: Find Programs or Libraries Related to a Particular Keyword on a UNIX Platform
item.description: Learn how to use the apropos utility to find out what programs installed on your machine will handle content of a given type.
item.author: Karthik Kumar kaykaydreamz@yahoo.com
